Kevin Flynn (Jeff Bridges) is a computer genius who one day disappeared without a trace. His son Sam (Owen Best), who was then seven years old, is raised by his grandparents and firm Flynn, the Encom, is managed by the remaining shareholders. Already 27 years old, Sam does not want to take control of the company and prefers to boycott it once a year. One day the right arm of her father, Alan Bradley (Bruce Boxleitner) receives a beep, which makes Sam go to where Kevin had a series of video game consoles. There Sam finds a secret passage that leads to a chamber where it is the last work of his father. Sam triggers and is taken to another world, technological, populated by computer programs.
